"You can encrypt your account, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media and other files. Once encrypted, a numeric PIN or password is required to decrypt your phone every time it is powered on. The only way to cancel encryption is to factory reset, which will erase all data on the phone.
The encryption process will take one hour or longer. Before you start the encryption, please make sure the battery is full and keep your phone plugged in. If the encryption is terminated, some or all of your data will be lost."
Please charge the battery and retry.
No lock screen PIN or password
You must set a lock screen PIN or password before you can start encryption.
You need to draw your unlock pattern to confirm encrypting your device.

Encrypt phone? This action is irreversible, and if you terminate the encryption, data will be lost. The encryption process will take one hour or longer, and your phone will be restarted several time during the process.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. Time remaining: ^1
Warning: Your device will be wiped after ^1 more failed attempts to be unlocked!

"Encryption is terminated and cannot be completed. As a result, you cannot access the data on your phone.
You have to factory reset your phone if you want to use it. When setting up your phone after factory reset is completed, you can restore all data backed up on your Google account to your phone."

"The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."
"When Face Unlock can't see you, how do you want to unlock?"
Disabled by administrator, encryption policy or credential storage

PIN must include at least %d characters
Password must contain less than %d characters
PIN must contain less than %d digits
PIN can only include numbers from 0-9
"Device administrator doesn't allow using a recent PIN."
Password must contain at least one letter
Password must contain at least one digit
Device administrator disallows using a recent password
An ascending, descending or repeated sequence of digits is forbidden

Input the PIN to pair with \" %1$s\".(try to type 0000 or 1234)
Input the passkey to pair with \" %1$s\".(try to type 0000 or 1234)

You may need to enter the pairing code on the other device.

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts, and more.
Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

"Apps may scan for nearby networks, even when Wi-Fi is off. If you don't want this to happen, go to Advanced > Scanning always available."

"When this feature is turned on, you can zoom in and out by triple-tapping the screen.
While zoomed in, you can: "
"Pan: Drag two or more fingers across the screen. "
Adjust zoom level: Pinch two or more fingers together or spread them apart."
You can also temporarily magnify what's under your finger by triple-tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: Triple-tap for magnification works everywhere except the keyboard and navigation bar."

"When this feature is turned on, you can quickly enable accessibility features in two steps:
Step 1: Press and hold the power button until you hear a sound or feel a vibration.
Step 2: Touch and hold two fingers until you hear audio confirmation. If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily enables accessibility until the device is unlocked."
This feature is experimental and may affect performance.
If you turn on %1$s, your device won’t use your screen lock to enhance data encryption.

Battery use is an approximation of power use and does not include every source of battery drain. Miscellaneous is the difference between the computed approximate power use and the actual drain observed on the battery.

"1. Pair vivo with your computer or other device. 2. Connect to vivo from computer or other device."

"1. Connect phone with PC over USB cable 2. Select \"Charge only\". 3. Enable \"Share PC network via USB\" in the configured access point. 4. Right click the network on your PC you want to share and select Properties. 5.
